Deficiency Narrative: Missing time and reason for placement in the admission assessment for two of two child records.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received an email from the operation including additional information in the placement agreement for why the child was placed and estimated length of stay to ensure that this section is not missed on future placement agreements.

Deficiency Narrative: Missing the contraidications in the admission assessment.
Correction Narrative:
RCCR received an email with an updated version of the admission assessment to include the following section to help ensure this is not missed in future assessments. "Describe child's current/past health concerns. (be sure to include any known
contraindications to the use of restraint)"

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple First Aide Kits were observed to be expired in both the cottage home and in the vehicles used to transport the children in care.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced inspection was conducted on 2/8/24, all first aid kits in the homes and transporation were  in compliance.  In the furture administrator will do monthly walk throughs of the vans and homes conducting spot checks for first aid kits remaining in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Food was observed to be expired in pantry, and left out exposed in cottage kitchen area as it was not properly stored.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced inspection was conducted on 2/8/24, all food in the pantry and house was in compliance and not expired.  In the furture administrator will do monthy walk throughs of the pantry and homes conducting spot checks for expired items.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed during a walk through that a electrical outlet did not have a wall cover.
Correction Narrative: An unannounced inspection was conducted on 2/8/24, observed the electrical outlet was covered and in compliance. To ensure this will continue to be in compliance in the future the campus director will inspect buildiings, especially after contract work is done.

Deficiency Narrative: It was discovered in review of two child records that a service plan was not created within 45 days of admission.
Correction Narrative: Received email from Director of Social Services stating: I have shortened the time for our due date alert email from 45 days to 40 days prior to the due date. This should give plenty of time to complete the initial service plan by the due date.

Deficiency Narrative: It was discovered that the suicide risk assessment was not conducted in one of two child records.
Correction Narrative: Received email from Director of social services stating: I created a new form in Extended Reach for the house parents to complete the screening at placement and then again every 90 days. However, since Christian was not present to complete the screening with me, I had the house parent complete the screening as soon as possible. A copy of the screening is attached.  The suicide screening for the child in question was also attached.

Deficiency Narrative: In reviewing medication logs for two youth, it was observed that several medication errors were not documented accordingly.  Medication errors were observed on various logs in relation to missed/skipped medications, medications given at the incorrect time, and relating to wrong dosage given.
Correction Narrative: The operations Director of Social Services, Israel Valdez, provided a response letter to the deficiencies listed on 06.09.22. All violations were discovered by the operation prior to investigation and written reprimand was issues to the caregivers.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed while reviewing medical record documentation and medication administration reports that the cumulative records for both children was not updated with the date of administration, time of administration and the signature of who administered the medication within the time frame required by minimum standards.
Correction Narrative: The operations Director of Social Services, Israel Valdez, provided a response letter to the deficiencies listed on 06.09.22. All violations were discovered by the operation prior to investigation and written reprimand was issues to the caregivers.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed while reviewing the medication records for both children, that a time was not included on the documentation of when the medication was administered.
Correction Narrative: The operations Director of Social Services, Israel Valdez, provided a response letter to the deficiencies listed on 06.09.22. All violations were discovered by the operation prior to investigation and written reprimand was issues to the caregivers.

Deficiency Narrative: Concerta Medication Log (date ranges 04/28/21-07/18/21) did not include the reason the medication was prescribed.
Correction Narrative: Email received from Mr. Valdez stating the caregivers simply failed to list the reason on the medication log and corrections were made to the logs to reflect the reason for the medication. These corrected logs will be kept on file, attached to original logs.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of the cottages, the evacuation plans were not posted that children were able to see where to go in an emergency.
Correction Narrative: Received pictures of Evacuation plans hung through the cottages. MLayton

Deficiency Narrative: During the review of the Initial Service plan, it was found parent and child signature was missing. There was also no documentation to show the parent, caregiver, and child received the plan.
Correction Narrative: The agency has reviewed their policy. They have also created a document that will go in each child's folder that will require signatures to show the child and parents received their copies. MLayton
